32
OWL and SWRL
Necessary and Sufficient Conditions (I)
All of the classes that we have created so far have only used
necessary conditions to describe them.
Necessary conditions can be read as: “If something is a member of
this class then it is necessary to fulfil these conditions”.
A class that only has necessary conditions is known as a Primitive Class or Partial Class.
With necessary conditions alone, we cannot say that, “If something
fulfils these conditions then it must be a member of this class”. To
make this possible we need to change the conditions from
necessary conditions to necessary AND sufficient conditions.
A class that has at least one set of necessary and sufficient conditions is known as a
Defined Class or Complete Class.
speaker: SYSTEM
